definition: thin piece of wood used a writing tablet (in ancient China)/a kind of official document (in former times)/letter/note/plague
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: The singer made his debut as Mozart's Don Giovanni.
sentences.chinese: 這位歌唱家初次登臺表演莫札特的唐喬凡尼。
小莫札特在中正紀念堂。

sentences.english: He wrote a famous biography of Mozart.
sentences.chinese: 他寫了本著名的莫札特傳。

sentences.english: The orchestra played a Mozart symphony.
sentences.chinese: 樂隊演奏了一首莫札特的交響曲。

sentences.english: Mozart early showed a remarkable talent for music.
sentences.chinese: 莫札特在早年顯露出對音樂的卓越才能。

sentences.english: All anybody needs to know about prizes is that Mozart never won one.
sentences.chinese: 對於得獎這件事，只要知道莫札特從未得過獎就夠了。

sentences.english: Tom:For me, Yo-Yo Ma is as amazing as Mozart.
sentences.chinese: 馬友友對我而言就好像莫札特一樣厲害。

sentences.english: Some leading authorities in the world of music had already begun comparing him with Mozart.
sentences.chinese: 當時音樂界的一些權威人士已開始將他與莫札特比較。

sentences.english: Mozart had a talented musician for a father.
sentences.chinese: 莫札特有一個才華洋溢的音樂家父親。

sentences.english: Mozart 's opera Don Giovanni was first performed, in Prague.
sentences.chinese: 莫札特的歌劇《唐璜》在捷克首都布拉格首次演出。

sentences.english: She gave a talk on Mozart to the college Music Society.
sentences.chinese: 她給學院音樂協會做了一次有關莫札特的談話。

definition: Rachmaninoff or Rachmaninov (name)/Sergei Rachmaninoff (1873-1943), Russian composer and pianist
pinyin: La1 he4 man4 ni2 nuo4 fu1

definition: Strauss (name) (Tw)/Johann Strauss (1825-1899), Austrian composer/Richard Strauss (1864-1949), German composer
Haydn (name)/Franz Joseph Haydn (1732-1809), Austrian classical composer
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
